Title: Evaluation of Budgeting Management Information System at DKI Jakarta Forestry Service
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, T.L., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to evaluate the budgeting management information system at the Forest Service of DKI Jakarta. Based on the concept and theory of information technology governance framework developed and carried out on the same domain parameters and processes as needed to build the research. Data were collected from questionnaires to 139 respondents. The respondents are active and routine employees using the information system contained at DKI Jakarta forestry service. Data were processed and analyzed using factor analysis method. From the results of data processing there are 5 factors along with the indicators that affect the level of understanding of information system users at DKI Jakarta forestry service. The five factors are strategic planning, maintenance and development, values alignment, user efficiency and response speed. From the evaluation results using the five factors it can be concluded that the governance information system at DKI Jakarta forestry service into the quiet good category. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: budgeting information system; factor analysis; forestry service
Index Keywords: Budget control; Data handling; Factor analysis; Forestry; Information use; Management information systems; Multivariant analysis; Surveys; Timber; Domain parameters; Evaluation results; Factor analysis method; Forest Service; Forestry services; Information technology governance; Response speed; User efficiencies; Information management
